attributes.action: demand the resignation of the Home Secretary for her failure to implement the recommendations of the independent Police Arbitration Tribunal in respect of Police pay and for the devious and underhanded way that she sought to influence the Treasury. Her behaviour has called her credibility as a member of the Government into question.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Following a failure to agree the Police Negotiating Board referred the issue of Police pay to the Police Arbitration Tribunal who recommended a 2.5% pay rise backdated to the 1st September 2007. The Home Secretary agreed to the pay rise of 2.5% but refused to backdate it which effectively reduces the pay settlement to 1.9%. Additionally the Home Secretary made this decision in a furtive, secretive and underhanded manner by confidential letter to the Treasury. Police Officers only became aware of this betrayal when the letter was leaked to the Daily Telegraph.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
